data.title: 10 Fastest Accelerated Online Bachelorâs of Computer Science
data.meta_description: Which are the fastest online bachelorâs degree programs in computer science in the US? The best accelerated programs deliver a quality education fast.
data.text:
Key Takeaways

An accelerated online computer science degree can be completed in 2-3 years rather than 4 or more years for a traditional computer science degree program.

Because of the condensed time frame of the fastest computer science degree programs, students must be technically adept as well as highly disciplined and organized.

Earning a bachelorâs in computer science degree online opens up numerous career opportunities that pay a higher-than-average salary.

Table of Contents

The best accelerated online computer science bachelorâs degree programs can be completed in four years or less. Students must be highly motivated and organized to keep up with the condensed curriculum and fast-pace as well as the strong focus on science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) skills.

Learners develop technical skills in computer science and transferable skills, too, including critical thinking, problem-solving, and analytical thinking skills, in the process.

Fastest Accelerated Online Bachelorâs Degree Programs in Computer Science

Note that we included a few on-campus computer science programs in this list to provide more options.

#1

Oregon State University

Corvallis , OR

Oregon State Universityâs B.S. in Computer Science program prepares future computer scientists whose skill sets are sought-after by diverse industries. The online bachelorâs in computer science accelerated program offers two concentrations for students to gain specialized skills in Applied Computer Science and Cybersecurity.

The accelerated computer science degree in cybersecurity has a more specialized focus while the applied computer science focus prepares students for a wide range of careers. Either specialization in computer science prepares students for success in the various aspects, from project management to software engineering design.

What we love about Oregon State University:

OSUâs wide range of academic programs - more than 300 for the undergraduate and graduate levels - means nearly every professional interest can be met. Sustainable food systems, marine sciences, and forestry are among the best academic programs in the country, too.

Students on forums such as Reddit and Quora have said that they love this school because theyâve been able to land high paying jobs from a school with an affordable in price. They also mention that the institution is well known in the Pacific Northwest, allowing students to find jobs with employers that are aware of the schoolâs reputation.

Oregon State University is ideal for students who:

Have a strong passion for research toward the betterment of humanity.

Oregon State University might not be the best fit for students who:

Prefer a laid-back, small campus community.

Official high school transcripts and/or college transcripts for transfer credits

ACT/SAT (Optional)

Letters of recommendation (Only if appealing an admission decision)

UISâ Bachelor of Science in Computer Science program has been designated as a National Center of Academic Excellence in Information Assurance Education. Its curriculum has the coveted Committee of National Security Systems and National Security Agency certification. Students can be assured of the highest quality of academic instruction.

Students in the accelerated computer science degree program must be prepared for the intensive coursework that builds a strong foundation of theories, principles, and practices in computer science. Their skills include the ability to design, develop, and maintain automated computer systems and networks, as well as demonstrate work professionalism.

What we love about University of Illinois Springfield:

We love Illinois Springfieldâs strong emphasis on contemporary liberal arts education. Add its Late Nite events, and you get a well-rounded college experience!

Students on forums such as Reddit and Quora have said that with a computer science degree from UIS, graduates shouldnât have trouble landing interviews due to the schoolâs great reputation. Students have also said that prospective students should be prepared to hone their time management skills, but as long as they put in the work, they should be able to graduate on time.

University of Illinois Springfield is ideal for students who:

Seek meaningful relationships with their peers and professors.

University of Illinois Springfield might not be the best fit for students who:

Seek more specialized academic programs.

Students can transfer credits to Franklinâs B.S. in Computer Science program and earn the degree faster. Students build their knowledge and skills in the design, development, and implementation of technology-based solutions using computer science principles and practices.

The online computer science program includes training in programming languages, particularly Java, Prolog, and Scheme, while its computer science courses build technical skills in software development, database management, and computer architecture. XML, XHTML and JSP use is also emphasized. Students in the accelerated computer science degree program are highly employable because of their well-rounded online education.

What we love about Franklin University:

We love its focus on adult learners that enables them to earn their college degrees and professional certifications at their convenience without sacrificing quality and affordability.

Students on forums such as Reddit and Quora have said that the accelerated bachelorâs in computer science from Franklin University offers a good mixture of theory and lab work. Students reported their biggest issues as being handling online projects and lab programs.

Franklin University is ideal for students who:

Benefit from career-oriented education and training

Franklin University might not be the best fit for students who:

Seek specialized academic programs.

If youâre more interested in the technical aspects of computer science, you may want to consider CityUâs B.S. in Applied Computer Science program. The program has less emphasis on computer science theory, but the coursework is just as intensive, challenging, and fast-paced.

The program is geared toward aspiring and current business-focused information technology professionals.

Students in the accelerated computer science degree program develop extensive technical skills in preparation for professional certification exams. These include Certified Information Systems Security Professional, the Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer, and Cisco Certified Network Associate exams.

The comprehensive practice-based curriculum also covers operating systems, computing fundamentals, and human-computer interaction, as well as threats against and measures for computer systems protection.

What we love about City University of Seattle:

CityUâs strong emphasis on career-relevant academic programs for adult learners is among the reasons for its high popularity.

Students on forums such as Reddit and Quora have said that the accelerated computer science degree at City University of Seattle is well laid out and structured. Students in this program found it easy to concentrate on specific areas of computer science of their choosing and to find internships that enabled them to grow in their skill sets.

City University of Seattle is ideal for students who:

Prefer the convenience, flexibility and affordability of quality online education.

City University of Seattle might not be the best fit for students who:

Seek more variety in academic programs and extracurriculars.

The on-campus B.S. in Computer Science program is among the most comprehensive programs of its kind, thanks to its comprehensive coverage of courses. The major technical areas covered include programming languages, software development, software engineering, and algorithms, among other sub-disciplines of computer science. Students must possess strong mathematical knowledge and skills to keep up with the fast-paced coursework.

Yet another benefit of the online accelerated computer science degree program is the choice between two concentrations. First, the General Computer Science concentration prepares students for a wide range of challenges in the field. Second, the Software Engineering concentration enables students to design, develop, and manage software systems as well as acquire project management skills.

What we love about Austin Peay State University:

APSUâs strong sense of community brought by its mid-sized student population, strong student support services, and dynamic extracurricular opportunities endear it to its students and alumni.

Students on forums such as Reddit and Quora have said that some of APSUâs curriculum was a little outdated a few years ago, but that the school has worked to improve the curriculum since then. Students also report that professors follow predictable teaching strategies and are easy to reach.

Austin Peay State University is ideal for students who:

Enjoy smaller class sizes, personalized attention, and hands-on learning experiences.

Austin Peay State University might not be the best fit for students who:

Seek specialized academic programs.

Students receive an excellent education with the B.S. in Computer Science, thanks partly to its Computing Accreditation Commission (ABET) accreditation. This is a challenging accelerated program where students learn the fundamental principles and practices of computer science including mobile apps design, computer programming and networking, and technical project management.

Thereâs a senior project that students must complete to earn a bachelorâs degree in computer science. The senior project demonstrates their basic mastery and ability to craft practical solutions to real-world issues in the computer science field.

Students in the computer science degree online program must also pass an exit exam that will demonstrate their mastery of math and computer science fundamentals. Earning the bachelorâs in computer science degree also means completion of a senior portfolio review; the portfolio consists of three papers, four programs, and two presentations, minimum.

What we love about Charleston Southern University:

We love its emphasis on Christian values that foster a strong sense of community, academic excellence and community involvement.

Students on forums such as Reddit and Quora have said the accelerated computer science degree at Charleston Southern University is a fantastic program with connections at virtually every local tech company, opening the door for possible internships. They also say that the school has a great technology/gaming room that is open to computer science majors only, another draw for potential students.

Charleston Southern University is ideal for students who:

Seek the integration of Christian values with academic success and career advancement.

Charleston Southern University might not be the best fit for students who:

Prefer a large campus with a diverse atmosphere and expansive resources.

Students in the B.S. in Computer Science program can choose from six concentrations that will enable them to build specialized skills in specific areas, including:

Applied Programming

Artificial Intelligence

Game and Simulation Programming

Mobile Application Development

Secure Programming

Systems Programming.

But students can also earn a bachelorâs in computer science degree without choosing a concentration. Students, furthermore, can also choose a minor to boost their employability; options include information technology, data science, and cybersecurity operations.

All students must work with an academic advisor that will contribute to their success in the computer science degree online program. Students with professional work experience in programming software and coding can apply for Prior Learning Assessment (PLA) credit.

What we love about Lewis University:

LewisU offers a fairly diverse range of academic programs complemented by numerous experiential learning, research and internship opportunities.

Students on forums such as Reddit and Quora have said that Lewis Universityâs reputation of having great internship connections and job placements lives up to the hype. Students have also said that while the school is sometimes slow in helping students with enrollment/financial aid paperwork, the professors and resources available to students are extremely helpful.

Lewis University is ideal for students who:

Appreciate its proximity to an urban center for career opportunities.

Lewis University might not be the best fit for students who:

Seek specialized academic programs and independent learning.

What we love about Concordia University - St. Paul:

Students on forums such as Reddit and Quora have said that time management is vital in Concordia Universityâs accelerated online computer science program. Some students have said that they felt a lack of support from professors, but that the program allowed them to find a job quickly and had prepared them well to enter the workforce.

Back to Top

Admission Requirements for Computer Science Online Bachelorâs Degree Programs

Due to the intensive study demands that accelerated online computer science degree programs have on their students, the admissions process is selective. The common minimum admissions requirements include:

High school diploma or the equivalent GED

Official high school transcripts and/or college transcripts

SAT/ACT scores

Personal statement or essay

Letters of recommendation

Application form and fee

Key Point: Some online accelerated computer science degrees may also require applicants to submit a short resume.

Back to Top

Things to Expect in Computer Science Online Bachelorâs Degree Programs

Every computer science program offers unique learning experiences for its online students. With that said, there are many similarities between accelerated online programs that can be a general reference for setting realistic expectations.

Condensed Coursework

Accelerated programs usually have a condensed curriculum that demands a rigorous study schedule from students. The condensed curriculum is possible by shortening the time-to-completion for the courses and removing the breaks between semesters.

Full-time Enrollment

Due to the accelerated coursework, students are usually required to enroll on a full-time basis. While external employment is possible, thanks to the online learning delivery, itâs more challenging with a full course load.

Transfer Credits

The best accelerated computer science degree programs accept transfer credits from college-level courses, such as Advanced Placement, DANTES, and CLEP, as well as computer science credits from professional work experience and certifications. Students can present proof and/or demonstrate their skills through prior learning assessments.

Supportive Learning Environment

Popular online computer science degree programs provide students with excellent student support services, including 24/7 tech support, online resources including access to digital libraries, and virtual office hours. Students also benefit from the synchronous and asynchronous learning formats, which include live classes, recorded lectures, and discussion forums.

Indeed, these are the best reasons for the enduring popularity of computer science degree online programs among traditional and nontraditional learners, including working professionals.

It is important to note that earning a computer science degree demands strong STEM skills and, thus, it may be best to start taking these types of classes during your high school years.

Bottom Line: While an accelerated online computer science degree can be demanding, they are a perfect option for busy working professionals. These students can complete classes on their own schedule by taking asynchronous courses.

And even better, the condensed time-to-graduation means that graduates get a career boost and bump in salary more quickly.

How Fast Can I Actually Get a Bachelorâs in Computer Science Online?

Every computer science program has its specific time-to-graduation because of its unique program curriculum and requirements. But most accelerated online computer science programs can be completed in 2-3 years, not only because of the accelerated format, but also because many of these programs allow transfer credits from prior learning, relevant work experience, and professional certifications. In our ranking, some of the schools offer degrees in as little as 17 months.

Note that the traditional bachelorâs degree in computer science can be earned in four years of full-time studies. But itâs more common for students to earn a bachelorâs degree in 5-6 years, on average.

Key Point: Students in an accelerated online computer science degree program must be sure that they have the time and discipline to complete the coursework.

Traditional computer science bachelorâs degree programs are challenging, but the courses in the fastest computer science degree programs online must be completed in a much shorter time frame. Students must be prepared to be diligent and focused in their studies.

Factors to Consider In Choosing an Online Bachelorâs Degree Program in Computer Science

When choosing from several online bachelorâs in computer science degree programs, here are the foremost features to consider.

Accreditation

Only enroll in an online computer science degree program offered by a regionally accredited college or university. Accreditation is an assurance of quality academic instruction, federal and state financial aid options, and industry and employer recognition.

Program Curriculum

Review the courses and their descriptions and learning outcomes to determine if these courses align with your personal interests and professional goals. The curriculum of accelerated computer science degree programs will also determine their length and pace.

Faculty and Resources

Ask about the credentials of the faculty members as well as the types and features of the resources, student support services, and career services offered in computer science programs. The best programs also provide students with access to the alumni network and, thus, allow them to establish their professional network in the computer science field.

Delivery Method and Technology Used

Online programs utilize a learning management system (LMS), of which the most popular are Canvas, Moodle, and Blackboard. Check for ease of access, user-friendly features, and flexible schedules, among other features.

Tuition and Fees

Of course, be sure to check the tuition and fees, among other aspects of cost of attendance, since these will be instrumental in your ability to earn the computer science degree.

Concentrations in Computer Science

Not every computer science program at the bachelorâs level offers concentrations or specializations, but here are a few of the most common ones:

Computer Engineering

If you want to become a computer hardware engineer, then a computer engineering concentration is an excellent choice. Its focus is on the design and development of computer hardware and its integrated components, systems and networks.

Computer Programming

This concentration enables students to develop knowledge and skills in programming languages and, thus, the design and development of software and solutions.

Data Analytics

Students learn the effective collection, analysis, and interpretation of large data sets that can be used in making data-driven decisions.

Database Management

This specialization results in students being able to design, implement, and manage databases used in the storage, organization, and retrieval of large data sets.

Information Technology

Students learn about the best principles and practices in the management of computer systems and its software, solutions, and networks.

Software Engineering

This concentration spans the entire life cycle of software systems, from their design and development to their management, including troubleshooting and upgrades.

Network Administration

Students develop skills crucial in the management and maintenance of computer networks that facilitate efficient resource sharing and data communication.

Common Courses in Computer Science Online Bachelorâs Degree Programs

The specific courses vary among online computer science programs. In general, however, bachelorâs degree in computer science programs include:

General education courses that build a strong foundation in the liberal arts and develop transferable skills.

Concentration courses that build technical skills in computer science, such as software and web development, programming languages, computer systems, and networks.

Elective courses that students can tailor to fit their learning experiences with their personal interests.

Most online bachelorâs degrees in computer science programs require students to complete a capstone course and project that demonstrate the studentâs ability to design and develop efficient computer systems.

Here are some common concentration courses:

Data Structures and Algorithms: learning basic data structures, various algorithms, analysis of algorithms, and implementations and applications of data structures

Object-Oriented Programming: learning about subjects such as polymorphism, abstraction, design patterns and their applications, and gaining practice in programming using OOP languages

Operating Systems: learning about the basic functions of an operating system, memory management, operating system design principles, and synchronization and deadlock handling

Software Engineering: learning about the software development life cycle models, software design principles and patterns, and software testing techniques and methodologies

Web Development: learning about front-end and back-end development, web architecture and protocols, user experience considerations, and deployment and hosting considerations

Networking and Security: learning the fundamentals of computer networks and the OSI model, network security concepts such as encryption and authentication, and common network attacks and countermeasures

Artificial Intelligence: learning the basic concepts of AI, deep learning frameworks and architectures, and ethical considerations and societal impacts of AI

Software Testing and Quality Assurance: learning testing techniques and automation tools, defect tracking and management, and continuous integration and continuous development pipelines

Popular Career Paths for Computer Science Bachelorâs Degree Holders

Online computer science graduates have career opportunities in a multitude of industries, from corporations to nonprofit organizations to government agencies. The Bureau of Labor Statistics projects the job growth rate for computer and information technology occupations to be 15% (2021-2031), which is among the fastest for all occupations.

With a median annual wage of $97,430, professionals in computer and information technology occupations are also among the highest-paid of all occupations.

The best computer science careers are outlined below. (The salary represents the median annual wages for the occupation)

Software Developers and Engineers ($109,020 per year)

Software developers design, develop, and test software systems and applications for diverse organizations.

Web Developers ($78,300 per year)

Web developers design, develop, and maintain websites, e-commerce platforms, and web and mobile apps using programming languages and other computer science tools.

Database Administrators and Architects ($101,000 per year)

These professionals create and manage computer systems used in the storage, organization, and retrieval of data in a safe and secure environment.

Network and Computer Systems Administrators ($80,600 annually)

Network and computer systems administrators install, manage, and troubleshoot issues in an organizationâs computer information systems and networks, as well as manage their day-to-day operations.

Information Security Analysts ($102,600 per year)

These professionals plan and implement security measures for protection against internal and external threats to the computer systems and networks of organizations.

Other popular career paths for computer science degree holders include information technology project managers, UX/UI designers, and machine learning/artificial intelligence engineers. Indeed, there are numerous career opportunities in the computer science field, which makes it possible to create a niche for yourself based on your interests.

You may also consider pursuing further education beyond your bachelorâs in computer science degree. You can pursue online computer science degrees at the masterâs degree and doctorate degree levels, as well as continue education via professional certifications. Popular choices are in information technology, web development, and software development, which can lead to leadership roles and/or cutting-edge research opportunities.

Did you know that there are also acclerated computer science degrees at the masterâs level? We take a deep dive in our ranking of the Fastest Accelerated Online Masterâs of Computer Science.

Bottom Line: Online accelerated computer science degrees qualify graduates for positions in numerous industries and command higher-than-average salaries.

Student Submitted Questions on Online Accelerated Computer Science Degrees

Kallan asks, âIs an accelerated online computer science degree just as comprehensive in its coverage as an on-campus, traditional program?â

Dr. James Barhamâs answer: Yes, it is. Especially today, schools have high standards for their online programs. Except for the condensed curriculum and online delivery, on-campus and online programs usually have the same breadth and depth in their coursework.

Lantana asks, âAre accelerated online computer science degree programs self-paced?â

Dr. Jed Macoskoâs answer: While thereâs a certain degree of flexibility, online accelerated programs usually have a structured format with specific timelines. Most, if not all, programs are cohort-based for this reason.

Mark asks, âDo employers recognize accelerated online BS in computer science degrees?â

Dr. James Barhamâs answer: Yes, they do! Of course, the online degree must be earned from an accredited college or university. Plus, relevant knowledge and skills combined with a good work attitude are usually more important in the hiring decision.

And with the high demand for graduates with computer science degrees, you canât go wrong with a quality accredited degree program.

Cyrus asks, âAre there particular people who benefit from an accelerated program more than others?â

Dr. Jed Macoskoâs answer: Typically, highly motivated and self-disciplined individuals fare better in these programs as the curriculum is extremely fast-paced. Also because of the speed of these programs, quick learners and goal-oriented students are usually more motivated to complete these programs well. Adult learners with prior experience in whatever field theyâre wishing to study might also do better as they have groundwork knowledge of the concepts that will be presented.
